definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: It was due to energy or charge transfer within the clusters.
sentences.chinese: 它起因于分子团内部的能量或电荷转移。

sentences.english: The typhoon is the cause of the electricity black-out .
sentences.chinese: 这个台风是造成停电的起因。

sentences.english: Being a hypnotherapist, we can work on emotional causes.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个催眠治疗师，我们可以研究情感上的起因。

sentences.english: Buffer overflows are the cause of many a security bug.
sentences.chinese: 缓冲区溢出是许多安全性问题的起因。

sentences.english: Just listen, understand, what is the cause of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 好好听，去理解，腐败堕落的起因是什么？

sentences.english: After jointing, coefficient of expansion leads to remain force.
sentences.chinese: 接合后存在残余应力起因于材料的热膨胀系数。

sentences.english: The different origins of unlevel dyeing (color streaks) as quality deficiency of textiles are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了作为纺织品质量问题的染色不匀的不同起因。

sentences.english: Trypanosoma gambiense is responsible for ninety percent of the reported cases of sleeping sickness.
sentences.chinese: 昏睡病病案报告的90%起因于冈比亚锥虫。

sentences.english: Specialist marine forecasting and surf camera service Coastalwatch said a rare weather event and the closeness of the low pressure system was the reason for the ocean's violence.
sentences.chinese: 和低气压系统是这次海岸暴力现象的起因。

sentences.english: The coating damage because of transportation installation and others should be repaired timely.
sentences.chinese: 因为运赢装置或其它起因制败的涂层破坏应及时修剜。

sentences.english: The physical origin of the gauge transformation is a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 这个规范变换的物理起因还是个谜。

sentences.english: My knowledge of Dr. Bethune began with an article entitled In Memory of Norman Bethune.
sentences.chinese: 我知道白求恩这个人，起因于一篇文章。

sentences.english: Acute ulcerations were responsible for significant gastrointestinal bleeding .
sentences.chinese: 急性溃疡形成是显著的胃肠出血的起因。

sentences.english: She adds that demographics examines the causes of improved longevity.
sentences.chinese: 她还说，人口统计检验寿命增长的起因。

sentences.english: The U-shape of some glacial valleys may be due also to deposition.
sentences.chinese: 某些U型冰川谷也可能起因于沉积作用。

sentences.english: About 60% of early-age crack of bulk concrete comes from the temperature shrinkage.
sentences.chinese: 大体积混凝土早期的开裂约60%起因于温度收缩。

definition: criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
lit. the first person to bury funerary dolls (idiom)/fig. the originator of an evil practice
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
